content.description: Stand start on large underclings and climb up to small iron crimps. Smear left on the large sloping foothold and continue up the tall slab to topout. Plenty of small intermediate crimps on this one.
content.location:
Between the two east facing overlooks at Cheat View. Walk north along the trail from the southern most overlook to the middle overlook. Turn right down a small break in the cliff line off the trail and continue right about 25 feet past a short sandy roof. The center line on the tall mossy slab is Vulture Wing.

(Approximate coords) 39.62154-79.816166

climbs.name: Pocket, Lock & Drop It
climbs.fa: Alec Manougian and Foster Tucker 2021 Equipped by Danny Rowand

content.description: Begin as with O'Brien is a Wimp, at the base of the double cracks on O'Brien is a Wimp. Continue up the crack until you reach the alcove. From here follow the diagonal crack up and left trending toward the seemingly blank face that is sprinkled with some perfect moves and a bolt. Move up and right through the heavily featured roof to the two bolt anchor.  Beware of loose rock in the roof as this is a recently established route.
content.protection: 2 bolt anchor, 2 bolts on the face, heavy on the small gear (#0.1 BD - #0.5 BD and a couple wide hand sized pieces for the initial crack)
content.location: Climber's right of the overlook about 25 30 ft around the corner from the blank face.

content.description: Either climb the double handcracks like a tall refrigerator or ride one of them to an alcove, then figure out your beta through finger-locks/tiny feet to an eventual standing position.  This climb has an obvious crux that will require some crack technique. It takes small gear well so no worries there. Just know if you sew it up you may be blocking a finger-lock or toe jam!  Super fun and the name begs some interesting questions!
content.protection: Micro gear to #4 for the alcove. as of january 2021 has new wavebolt glue in anchors with quicklinks and carabiners
content.location: Climber's right of Archangel.   About 45 ft to climber's right of the main overlook.  You'll know you're here when you're at the base of a side-by-side handcrack that joins about 15 ft up to nice alcove before the crux finger section.

content.description: Begins with a scramble to the base of a small left-facing corner with a hand-sized crack. Ride this until the corner flips to face the right. The wall then begins to kick back and crack gets slightly smaller.  Be on the lookout up there for a couple pockets on the right side of the arete.  This climb has some compression moves at the top and can feel pretty burly.  It was originally given a grade of 5.9+... but in 2020 5.10 seems a bit more appropriate.
content.protection: At least a double rack of #0.5-#2, single #3, should be sufficient. As of jan 2021, theres new glue in wavebolt anchors with quicklinks and carabiners
content.location: Closest route to the overlook cliff.

content.description:
A left-arching crack that consists of jamming, stemming, laybacking. Very picturesque and climbed a while back by the local crushers that eventually took their skills down to the New River Gorge.

This climb can be persistently wet after a good bit of rain, but does dry up nicely after about a week of no precipitation.
content.protection: new wavebolt glue in anchors with quicklinks and carabiners as of jan 2021. 0.4-#4. doubles of #1,2,3 to sew it up
content.location: Climbers right under the Main Overlook by about 30-40 ft. You will not be in a line of fire of anything falling off the overlook. The top of the cliff here is heavily vegetated.
